name: FetchHubdbTableRows
description:
Fetch rows from a HubDB table using filters and sorting.

Use this tool to fetch rows from a specific HubDB table. You can apply filters and sorting by using query parameters, allowing retrieval of customized data sets. No authentication is needed if the table allows public access.

parameters.name: table_identifier
parameters.description: The ID or name of the HubDB table to query for fetching row data.

value_schema.description: The ID or name of the table to query.

parameters.name: sort_columns
parameters.description: List of column names to sort the results by. Each entry is a string representing a column. Prefix with '-' for descending order.

value_schema.description: Specifies the column names to sort the results by. See the above description for more details.

parameters.name: pagination_cursor_token
parameters.description: Cursor token to fetch the next set of results. Obtainable from the `paging.next.after` of a paged response.

value_schema.description: The cursor token value to get the next set of results. You can get this from the `paging.next.after` JSON property of a paged response containing more results.

parameters.name: maximum_results_limit
parameters.description: Specifies the maximum number of results to return. The default value is 1000, which can be adjusted to retrieve fewer entries.

value_schema.description: The maximum number of results to return. Default is `1000`.

parameters.name: requested_columns
parameters.description: Specify column names to retrieve only the required columns' data, excluding others.

value_schema.description: Specify the column names to get results containing only the required columns instead of all column details.

parameters.name: row_offset
parameters.description: The starting point for fetching a subset of rows, useful for pagination. It's similar to specifying which row to start fetching from.

parameters.name: include_archived_rows
parameters.description: Set to true to include archived rows in the results; false to exclude them.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the hubspot_cms API.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Specifies the column names to sort the results by. See the above description for more details.

value_schema.description: Specifies the column names to sort the results by. See the above description for more details.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: The cursor token value to get the next set of results. You can get this from the `paging.next.after` JSON property of a paged response containing more results.

value_schema.description: The cursor token value to get the next set of results. You can get this from the `paging.next.after` JSON property of a paged response containing more results.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to return. Default is `1000`.

value_schema.description: The maximum number of results to return. Default is `1000`.

parameters.name: properties
parameters.description: Specify the column names to get results containing only the required columns instead of all column details.

value_schema.description: Specify the column names to get results containing only the required columns instead of all column details.

parameters.name: tableIdOrName
parameters.description: The ID or name of the table to query.

value_schema.description: The ID or name of the table to query.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
